Advanced Battle

In the Simple Battle tutorial you learned how to fight a basic enemy. In this tutorial you will learn how to battle with more than one enemy at a time and how to handle their special abilities like Resistance and Fortification. Enemies might have other types of abilities like Immunity (ignoring special effects from cards) or Attack Modifiers that changes the way you should Attack or Block them. Pay special attention to these before you engage in Battle. Contrary to Movement & Exploration, during Battle you can Undo everything until you commit the results of the Battle (in the After Battle phase). To be successful at this game you need to experiment with multiple combinations until you are satisfied with the result.
[Before Battle] Remove an Enemy Elemental <style="status">Resistance</style>
[Before Battle] Activate a card to generate an effect that removes Elemental resistance. Use the effect list command (el) or the enemy description command (mo) to target an enemy with that effect
Enemy Resistance

Enemies with Resistance to Physical or Elemental Damage will ignore non-attack/non-block effects of cards of the same color: Physical = White | Fire = Red | Frost = Blue. If you are using special abilities like Destroying enemies, Cancelling their attacks, etc, pay attention to their Resistances before entering Battle. You can invest in Abilities to remove Resistances in the Before Battle phase.
[Before Battle] <style="status">Undo</style> and Bypass Enemy <style="status">Fortification</style>

[Before Battle] Use the Card description command (d space c) to deactivate the activated cards. Then activate a card to generate an effect that removes Fortification. Use the effect list command (el) or the enemy description command (mo) to target an enemy with that effect
Enemy Fortification

Most Enemies are not Fortified but the Location can grant them Fortification. Range Attacks won't work and you need Siege Attacks instead in the Range Phase. You can find Abilities that would remove Fortifications in the Before Battle phase.
Group then defeat the Enemies in the Range Phase

Use the phase change command (ph) to move to the Range phase. Use the grouping command (gp) to create a group and add all enemies to this group. Generate Range Attack effects and target the group to eliminate all the enemies in this group. Note that grouped enemies share resistances and fortifications so you should remove Fortifications in the Before Battle phase before attacking. And don't forget you also have followers and blessings to help you
Grouping Enemies

You can Group multiple enemies in the Range and Attack phases. Note: You still need to Block Enemy attacks individually in the Block phase. Grouped enemies will benefit from Resistances and Fortifications of other enemies in the group. You can group & ungroup enemies however you want (similar to Undo).
Undo and Group then defeat the Enemies in the Attack Phase

Deactivate the activated cards (d space c) or blessings (d space b) and disband then re-group (gp) then defeat the Enemies in the Attack Phase instead. Then use the battle status command (st) to commit the battle and end the tutorial
Defeating All Enemies

The battle will only be successful if you defeat all enemies faced. In some cases, enemies rampaging the map might be added to enemies occupying a location, in this case the battle would succeed when all occupying enemies are defeated (ignoring the rampaging ones).
